intro: Isochilus unilateralis, commonly known as the one-sided beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its unique, bilaterally symmetric flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color. Isochilus unilateralis has linear, grass-like leaves and is known for its distinctive, one-sided floral structure that sets it apart from other members of its genus.
